basics.name: Tiffany Duong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an undergraduate student pursuing a B.A. in Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, with an expected graduation in Fall 2025. My studies have developed my skills in front-end development and created an interest in designing engaging and user-friendly interfaces. Additionally, I plan to continue my education in Library Science at the graduate level.

education.institution: Theodore Roosevelt High School, Honolulu, HI

work.company: UH Manoa Molecular Biosciences and Engineering
highlights: Provide administrative support and perform technical tasks as assigned by supervisor
Handle general office duties, including filing, data entry, and managing correspondence
Assisted customers with inquiries, provided personalized styling recommendations, and resolved issues to ensure a positive shopping experience
Processed transactions accurately and maintained an organized, welcoming store environment
Volunteered at various events, contributing donations to schools and hospitals, and earned over 200 hours of community service
Attended weekly practices and participated in the 2019 Hawaii State National Archery in the Schools Program Tournament
Assisted in fundraising efforts and participated in community beautification projects
Contributed to community donations and learned disaster preparedness skills to support myself and others
Participated in cleanup events to beautify Oahu by collecting and properly disposing of litter, while raising awareness of environmental issues

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Special recognition awarded to undergraduate students earning a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
